full_text: When we announced that we would have this pilot going, then we had more than twice the requests to join, then we actually had seats. [music] We've [music] been partners with OpenAI for about a year. Um, we're mainly working currently with the SHA GPT rolling that out across the enterprise. uh but we're also exploring the use of APIs. [music] >> We put quite a lot of uh licenses available in the organization and we stimulate experimentation as much as [music] possible. >> [music] >> when we did the introduction then everyone was uh only allowed to join if they joined us the whole team so that it's not dependent on one smart guy building a GPT for his his team and then moving on and no one understood what he did rather we wanted to get sort of yeah into the team DNA >> so we are very much organization which decentralizes decision-m very much lower in the organization and that's that's I think a strength right now when we work with >> [music] >> uh open AI uh with chat GPT to allow the organization to experiment to test and there's also a lot of u pull in the organization to really get it >> the pace of the requests [music] that we are getting is just expanding and getting [music] higher and higher >> speed of adoption >> speed of getting results >> I mean you expect results but it's it's going faster. >> It's going faster in time. It's going faster in in the quality.
